intro: Tommasinia, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the western United States and parts of Canada, typically growing in rocky, well-drained soils. The plants are shrubs with evergreen leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. They are adapted to harsh environments and are often found in mountainous regions. Tommasinia species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in their native habitats.
